creator: Legislative Assembly
extent: 1 map : mounted on linen ; 42.2 x 76.8 cm. on sheet 45.7 x 83.4 cm.
notes: Horizontal scale is 1 inch = 80 feet; vertical scale 1 inch = 40 feet. Areas measured: The Red River at Dr. Bunn's house; The Assinniboine River at Lane's Post, at Little Souris, at Fort Ellice and at its mouth; Little Saskatchewan or Dauphin River 5 miles from its mouth; South branch of the Saskatchewan near the elbow; The Saskatchewan river at Fort a la Corne and at Bigstone River; Fishing Lake no. 3 in the Qu'Apelle Valley; and Valley of the Assinniboine near Fort Ellice. Part of collection of maps from the 1858 Assinniboine & Saskatchewan Exploring Expedition. To accompany text by Henry Youle Hind. Toronto: John Lovell, 1859.
subject: Prairie Provinces
Assiniboine River (Sask. and Man.)
Red River of the North
Saskatchewan River (Sask. and Man.)
Souris River
South Saskatchewan River (Alta. and Sask.)
title: Cross-section of portions of Rupert's Land surveyed and examined by the Assiniboine and Saskatchewan Exploring Expedition in the year 1858 - under instructions from the Provincial Secretary, Canada
